DataElement.preferredName: Throat Mucosa Palpation Abnormal or Suspicious Finding Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not an abnormal or suspicious lesion was found on palpation of the muscosal site.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth._Mucous membrane._A method of feeling with the hands during a physical examination. The health care provider touches and feels the patient's body to examine the size, consistency, texture, location and tenderness of an organ or body part._Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth.:Mucous membrane.

Concepts.definition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method of feeling with the hands during a physical examination. The health care provider touches and feels the patient's body to examine the size, consistency, texture, location and tenderness of an organ or body part.:Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: A method of feeling with the hands during a physical examination. The health care provider touches and feels the patient's body to examine the size, consistency, texture, location and tenderness of an organ or body part.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.
